questions.question_en: Why does ice float on water?
choices_en: Ice is filled with air bubbles
Ice is less dense than water
explanations_en: Wrong. While ice can trap some air bubbles, this isn't why it floats. Pure ice without bubbles still floats because its molecular structure makes it less dense than water.

Correct! Ice is less dense than liquid water, which is unusual. When water freezes, molecules arrange in a crystal structure with more space between them. This makes ice about 9% less dense than water. So ice floats! This property is crucial for aquatic life, as frozen lakes stay liquid underneath.
Wrong. Surface tension can hold very light objects on water, but ice floats due to its lower density, not surface tension. Even large icebergs float.
Wrong. Temperature doesn't create an upward force. Ice floats because when water freezes into a crystal structure, it becomes less dense than liquid water.
explanations_zh: 不对。虽然冰会困住一些气泡，但这并非其漂浮的原因。即使没有气泡的纯冰也会漂浮，因为其分子结构使其密度低于水。
正确！冰的密度比液态水小，这很不寻常。当水结冰时，分子会排列成晶体结构，彼此间留有更多空间，使得冰的密度比水低约9%。因此冰能漂浮！这一特性对水生生物至关重要，因为冰冻的湖泊下方仍保持液态。
错误。表面张力可以支撑很轻的物体浮在水面上，但冰浮起来是因为其密度较低，而非表面张力。即便是巨大的冰山也能漂浮。
不对。温度并不会产生向上的力。冰能浮起来是因为水结成晶体结构时，其密度比液态水小。

questions.question_en: Why do microwaves heat food?
explanations_en: Correct! Microwaves are electromagnetic waves that make water molecules vibrate rapidly. Food contains lots of water. When water molecules spin back and forth billions of times per second, this friction creates heat. That's why foods with more water heat faster, and why empty plates stay cool!

Wrong. Microwaves don't cause chemical reactions in food. They simply make water molecules vibrate, creating heat through friction. Cooking may cause chemical changes, but that's from the heat, not the microwaves directly.
Wrong. Microwaves don't work by compressing air. They penetrate food and directly cause water molecules inside to vibrate and generate heat.
Wrong. Microwaves and infrared are different types of electromagnetic radiation. Microwaves work by causing water molecules to vibrate, not by emitting infrared heat.
explanations_zh: 正确！微波是使水分子快速振动的电磁波。食物中含有大量水分，当水分子以每秒数十亿次的速度来回旋转时，这种摩擦会产生热量。这就是为什么水分多的食物加热更快，而空盘子依然保持凉爽的原因！
错误。微波并不会在食物中引发化学反应，它们只是使水分子振动，通过摩擦产生热量。烹饪可能导致化学变化，但那是由热量引起的，而非微波直接作用。
错误。微波并非通过压缩空气工作，而是穿透食物，直接使内部水分子振动并产生热量。
错误。微波和红外线是不同类型的电磁辐射。微波的工作原理是使水分子振动，而不是通过发射红外热。

questions.question_en: Why does a ball bounce?
choices_en: Air inside pushes it back up
explanations_en: Wrong. While air pressure in the ball helps maintain its shape, bouncing happens because the ball's material compresses and releases elastic energy, not just from air pressure.

Correct! When a ball hits the ground, it compresses and stores elastic energy, like a spring. This stored energy pushes the ball back to its original shape, launching it upward. Some energy is lost as heat and sound, so each bounce is lower. Materials like rubber store more energy and bounce better!
Wrong. The ground doesn't repel the ball. The bounce comes from elastic energy stored when the ball compresses on impact, then releases as it returns to its original shape.
Wrong. Gravity never reverses - it always pulls downward. The ball bounces up due to elastic energy released when the compressed ball springs back to its original shape.
explanations_zh: 错误。虽然球内气压有助于维持其形状，但球的弹跳是因为其材料压缩并释放弹性势能，而不仅仅是由于气压的作用。
正确！当球撞击地面时，它会像弹簧一样压缩并储存弹性势能。这种储存的能量推动球恢复原状，使其向上弹起。部分能量会以热和声的形式散失，因此每次弹跳高度都会降低。像橡胶这样的材料能储存更多能量，弹跳效果更好！
不对。地面并不会排斥球。球的弹跳来源于撞击时球体压缩所储存的弹性势能，随后在恢复原状时释放出来。
错误。重力从不反向——它总是向下拉。球之所以弹起，是因为当被压缩的球恢复原状时释放出的弹性势能。

questions.question_en: Why do mirrors reverse left and right?
choices_en: Your brain interprets it that way
explanations_en: Wrong. Mirrors don't flip light horizontally. They reflect light straight back at the same angle. The apparent left-right reversal is actually a front-to-back flip.
Wrong. While your brain does interpret the reflection, mirrors actually reverse front to back, not left to right. You perceive it as left-right because you imagine yourself turned around.

Correct! Mirrors don't reverse left-right - they reverse front to back! When you face a mirror, your front becomes the mirror's back. If you raise your right hand, the person in the mirror also raises their right hand (from their perspective). We think it's reversed because we imagine turning around to face the same direction as our reflection.
Wrong. Glass doesn't bend light sideways in a flat mirror. Mirrors reflect light at equal angles. The reversal is front-to-back, not left-right or due to bending.
explanations_zh: 不对。镜子并不会水平翻转光线，而是以相同角度将光线直接反射回去。看似左右颠倒的现象实际上是前后翻转。
不对。虽然你的大脑确实在解读镜像，但实际上镜子是前后翻转，而非左右颠倒。你之所以感觉是左右颠倒，是因为你想象自己转了个身。
正确！镜子并不会左右颠倒——它们是前后翻转！当你面对镜子时，你的前方变成了镜中的后方。如果你举起右手，镜中的人也会举起他们的右手（从他们的视角看）。我们之所以认为它颠倒了，是因为我们想象自己转身与镜中映像面向同一方向。
错误。在平面镜中，玻璃不会使光线侧向弯曲。镜子以相等角度反射光线。这种反转是前后方向的，而非左右或由弯曲引起。

questions.question_en: Why does sound travel faster in water?
questions.question_zh: 声音在水中为何传播更快？
explanations_en: Correct! Sound travels by molecules bumping into each other. Water molecules are much closer together than air molecules - water is about 800 times denser. When molecules are closer, they transfer vibrations faster. Sound travels at 343 m/s in air but 1,480 m/s in water - over 4 times faster!
Wrong. Water doesn't amplify sound waves. Sound travels faster in water because molecules are closer together, allowing vibrations to transfer more quickly from one molecule to the next.
Wrong. While pressure exists in water, that's not why sound travels faster. The key is molecular spacing - water molecules are closer together than air molecules, allowing faster vibration transfer.
Wrong. Electrical conductivity is unrelated to sound speed. Sound is a mechanical wave that travels through matter by molecular vibrations, not electrical signals.
explanations_zh: 正确！声音通过分子相互碰撞传播。水分子比空气分子紧密得多——水的密度大约是空气的800倍。分子间距越近，振动传递越快。声音在空气中的传播速度为343米/秒，而在水中高达1480米/秒——快了四倍多！
错误。水并不会放大声波。声音在水中传播得更快，是因为水分子间距更近，使得振动能更快地从一个分子传递到另一个分子。
错误。虽然水中存在压力，但这并非声音传播更快的原因。关键在于分子间距——水分子比空气分子更紧密，使得振动传递更快。
错误。电导率与声速无关。声音是一种机械波，通过分子振动在物质中传播，而非电信号。

questions.question_en: Why do ice cubes crack in warm water?
explanations_en: Correct! This is called thermal shock. The outside of the ice cube heats and expands quickly while the inside stays cold and contracted. This creates stress between the layers. Like glass in hot water, the ice can't handle the uneven expansion and cracks! The warmer the water, the louder the crack.
Wrong. Water doesn't dissolve ice by breaking it apart. Ice cracks due to thermal shock - the outside expands from heat while the inside stays cold, creating internal stress.
Wrong. While ice can contain tiny air bubbles, they don't cause the cracking sound. The crack comes from thermal stress as the outer layer expands faster than the frozen core.
Wrong. No chemical reaction occurs - it's purely physical. The cracking is from thermal stress when different parts of the ice expand at different rates due to temperature differences.
explanations_zh: 正确！这被称为热冲击。冰块外部迅速受热膨胀，而内部仍保持低温收缩，导致层间产生应力。就像玻璃放入热水中一样，冰块无法承受不均匀的膨胀而破裂！水温越高，破裂声越响。
错误。水并非通过分解来融化冰。冰裂是由于热冲击造成的——外部受热膨胀而内部仍保持低温，产生内应力所致。
错误。虽然冰块中可能含有微小的气泡，但它们并非产生破裂声的原因。破裂声实际上是由于冰块外层比内部冻结的核心更快膨胀，导致热应力而产生的。
错误。并未发生化学反应——这纯粹是物理现象。冰裂是由于温度差异导致冰块各部分以不同速率膨胀，从而产生热应力所致。

questions.question_en: Why do ships float but stones sink?
choices_en: Ships are made of lighter materials
explanations_en: Wrong. Ships are often made of steel, which is denser than stone! The material doesn't matter - it's the shape. A hollow ship displaces more water than its weight, creating enough buoyant force to float.
Wrong. Water pressure acts equally in all directions. Ships float because of buoyancy - they displace a volume of water weighing more than the ship itself.

Correct! This is Archimedes' principle! A ship's hollow shape lets it displace a huge volume of water. If the water displaced weighs more than the ship, it floats. A stone is solid and compact - it can't displace enough water to equal its weight, so it sinks. That's why a steel ship floats but a steel ball sinks!
Wrong. Engines power the ship but don't make it float. Even without engines, a properly shaped hull floats by displacing water equal to its weight.
explanations_zh: 错误。船通常由钢材制成，其密度比石头还大！材料并不重要——关键在于形状。空心船体排开的水量超过其自身重量，从而产生足够的浮力使其漂浮。
错误。水压是向各个方向均匀作用的。船只能浮起来是因为浮力——它们排开的水的重量大于船自身的重量。
正确！这就是阿基米德原理！船的中空结构使其能排开大量水体。若排开的水重量超过船自身重量，船便浮起。石头则实心且致密——它无法排开足够与其重量相当的水，因此下沉。这就是为什么钢制轮船能漂浮，而钢珠却会沉没！
错误。发动机为船只提供动力，但并非使其漂浮的原因。即使没有发动机，一个形状合适的船体通过排开与其重量相等的水也能漂浮。

questions.question_en: Why does a compass always point north?
choices_en: Gravity is stronger at the poles
explanations_en: Correct! Earth acts like a giant magnet with a magnetic field running from south to north. A compass needle is a tiny magnet that can spin freely. It aligns with Earth's magnetic field lines, with one end pointing to the magnetic north pole. Interestingly, Earth's magnetic north is near the geographic North Pole but not exactly the same!
Wrong. Stars don't exert magnetic force on a compass. The needle aligns with Earth's magnetic field, which is generated by molten iron flowing in Earth's outer core.
Wrong. Gravity pulls downward and is roughly equal everywhere on Earth's surface. A compass works due to magnetism, not gravity. The needle aligns with Earth's magnetic field.
Wrong. Temperature doesn't magnetize the needle or affect its direction. The needle is already magnetized and responds to Earth's magnetic field, which exists regardless of air temperature.
explanations_zh: 正确！地球就像一个巨大的磁铁，其磁场从南向北延伸。指南针的指针是一个可以自由旋转的小磁铁，它会与地球的磁场线对齐，一端指向磁北极。有趣的是，地球的磁北极靠近地理北极，但并不完全重合！
不对。星星不会对指南针施加磁力。指南针的指针是与地球磁场对齐的，而地球磁场是由地球外核中流动的熔融铁产生的。
错误。重力向下作用，且在地球表面各处大致相等。指南针的工作原理是磁力而非重力，指针会与地球磁场对齐。
不对。温度不会使针磁化，也不会影响其方向。针本身已经磁化，并对地球磁场作出反应，而地球磁场的存在与气温无关。

questions.question_en: Why do we see lightning before thunder?
questions.question_zh: 为何先见闪电后闻雷声？
explanations_en: Correct! Light travels at 300,000 km/s while sound only travels at 343 m/s in air - light is almost a million times faster! Lightning and thunder happen at the same instant, but light reaches your eyes almost immediately while sound takes time. Count seconds between flash and thunder, divide by 3 - that's roughly how many kilometers away the lightning struck!
Wrong. Your senses react at similar speeds. The delay is because light travels much faster than sound - about a million times faster! They both start at the same moment from the lightning.
Wrong. Lightning and thunder happen simultaneously. The lightning creates the thunder by rapidly heating air. You see light first because it travels much faster than sound.
Wrong. While clouds can slightly muffle sound, that's not why you hear thunder later. Sound travels much slower than light - that's the real reason for the delay.
explanations_zh: 没错！光的传播速度是每秒30万公里，而声音在空气中的速度仅为每秒343米——光速几乎是声速的百万倍！闪电和雷声同时发生，但光几乎瞬间抵达你的眼睛，而声音则需要时间。计算闪电与雷声之间的秒数，再除以3，就能大致得出闪电发生的距离（公里数）！
不对。你的感官反应速度相近。之所以有延迟，是因为光速远快于声速——大约快一百万倍！它们都是从闪电发生的同一时刻开始的。
不对。闪电和雷声是同时发生的。闪电通过迅速加热空气产生雷声。你先看到闪电是因为光速远大于声速。
不对。虽然云层能稍微减弱声音，但那不是你后来才听到雷声的原因。声音传播速度远慢于光速——这才是延迟的真正原因。

questions.question_en: Why does a spinning coin eventually fall?
explanations_en: Wrong. Air resistance has a small effect, but friction between the coin and surface is the main cause. As friction steals rotational energy, the coin spins slower, wobbles more, and eventually falls.

Correct! A spinning coin stays upright due to angular momentum - like a gyroscope. But friction between the coin's edge and the surface gradually removes this rotational energy. As it spins slower, it can't maintain balance and starts wobbling. Eventually, there's not enough spin to keep it upright, and gravity wins - the coin falls flat!
Wrong. Magnetism doesn't affect most coins' spinning. The coin falls because friction removes its rotational energy, causing it to slow down and lose the gyroscopic stability that kept it upright.
Wrong. Weight doesn't change when spinning. The coin falls because friction gradually removes its angular momentum. With less spin, it can't maintain the gyroscopic effect that keeps it balanced.
explanations_zh: 不对。空气阻力的影响很小，主要是硬币与表面之间的摩擦力造成的。随着摩擦力不断消耗旋转能量，硬币会转得越来越慢，晃动加剧，最终倒下。
正确！旋转的硬币因角动量保持直立，就像陀螺仪一样。但硬币边缘与表面之间的摩擦力会逐渐消耗这种旋转能量。随着转速减慢，它无法保持平衡并开始摇晃。最终，当旋转不足以支撑其直立时，重力占了上风——硬币便倒下了！
不对。磁性不会影响大多数硬币的旋转。硬币倒下是因为摩擦力消耗了其旋转能量，导致它减速并失去保持直立的陀螺稳定性。
错误。旋转时重量不会改变。硬币掉落是因为摩擦力逐渐消耗了它的角动量。旋转减弱后，便无法维持保持平衡的陀螺效应。

questions.question_en: Why do magnets attract iron?
explanations_en: Wrong. Iron isn't naturally magnetic until exposed to a magnet. Iron contains magnetic domains that normally point in random directions, canceling each other out.

Correct! Iron contains millions of tiny magnetic regions called domains. Normally they point randomly and cancel out. When a magnet comes near, it aligns these domains in the same direction, temporarily magnetizing the iron. The aligned domains create magnetic poles that attract to the magnet. Remove the magnet, and the domains may stay aligned (making iron magnetic) or randomize again!
Wrong. Magnetism and static electricity are different forces. Magnets work through magnetic fields that align the magnetic domains in iron, not through electrical charge.
Wrong. Gravity affects all matter equally and is far weaker than magnetism. Magnets attract iron through magnetic force by aligning iron's internal magnetic domains.
explanations_zh: 错误。铁在接触磁铁前并不天然具有磁性。铁内部含有磁畴，这些磁畴通常指向随机方向，相互抵消磁性。
正确！铁中含有数百万个被称为磁畴的微小磁性区域。通常情况下，它们指向随机方向并相互抵消。当磁铁靠近时，它会将这些磁畴排列成同一方向，使铁暂时磁化。排列整齐的磁畴形成磁极，与磁铁相互吸引。移开磁铁后，磁畴可能保持排列状态（使铁具有磁性），也可能再次变得杂乱无章！
错误。磁力和静电是两种不同的力。磁铁通过磁场使铁中的磁畴排列整齐，而不是通过电荷作用。
错误。引力对所有物质的作用相同，且远弱于磁力。磁铁通过磁力吸引铁，是通过调整铁内部磁畴的方向实现的。

questions.question_en: Why does hot air rise?
explanations_en: Wrong. Heat doesn't change air's weight. When air heats up, molecules move faster and spread out, making the air less dense. Less dense air floats above denser cool air.

Correct! When air heats, molecules move faster and spread apart, taking up more space. This makes hot air less dense than cold air. Since denser fluids sink and less dense fluids rise (like oil on water), hot air floats upward through cooler, denser air. This convection creates wind, makes hot air balloons fly, and circulates heat in your home!
Wrong. Pressure differences result from density changes, they don't cause hot air to rise. Hot air rises because it's less dense than the surrounding cooler air.
Wrong. Steam is water vapor, not related to why hot air rises. Hot air rises due to lower density - heated air molecules spread out, making it lighter than the denser cold air below.
explanations_zh: 错误。热量不会改变空气的重量。当空气受热时，分子运动加快并扩散，使得空气密度降低。密度较低的空气会浮在密度较高的冷空气之上。
正确！空气受热时，分子运动加快并扩散，占据更多空间，使得热空气密度低于冷空气。由于密度高的流体会下沉，密度低的则上升（如水上的油），热空气便通过较冷较密的空气向上浮动。这种对流现象形成了风，让热气球得以升空，并在家中循环热量！
错误。压力差是由密度变化引起的，而不是导致热空气上升的原因。热空气上升是因为它比周围的冷空气密度小。
不对。蒸汽是水蒸气，与热空气上升的原因无关。热空气上升是因为其密度较低——受热的空气分子扩散开来，使其比下方密度较高的冷空气更轻。

questions.question_en: Why is the ocean blue?
explanations_en: Wrong. While the sky can affect surface appearance, pure water itself is blue. Water molecules preferentially absorb red, orange, and yellow light, while blue light passes through and scatters back to our eyes.

Correct! Water molecules absorb different colors of light at different rates. Red, orange, and yellow light are absorbed more than blue light. In deep water, only blue light penetrates deeply and scatters back to our eyes. That's why shallow water looks clear but deep ocean appears blue. The same property makes ice and thick water appear blue too!
Wrong. Salt doesn't make seawater blue - even pure fresh water appears blue when deep enough. The blue color comes from water absorbing red wavelengths while scattering blue light.
Wrong. While algae can tint water green or brown, the ocean's blue color comes from water itself. Water absorbs red light and scatters blue light, making deep water appear blue.
explanations_zh: 错误。虽然天空会影响水面外观，但纯净水本身是蓝色的。水分子优先吸收红、橙、黄光，而蓝光则穿透并被散射回我们眼中。
正确！水分子对不同颜色光的吸收速率不同，红、橙、黄光比蓝光更容易被吸收。在深水中，只有蓝光能深入穿透并散射回我们眼中。这就是为什么浅水看起来清澈，而深海呈现蓝色的原因。同样的特性也使得冰和厚层水看起来呈蓝色！
错误。盐并非使海水呈现蓝色的原因——即使是纯净的淡水，在足够深时也会显出蓝色。这种蓝色源于水吸收红色波长而散射蓝光的特性。
错误。虽然藻类能使水呈现绿色或棕色，但海洋的蓝色源于水本身。水吸收红光并散射蓝光，使得深水看起来呈蓝色。

questions.question_en: Why does glass break?
explanations_en: Correct! Glass is brittle because its molecules are locked in a rigid, amorphous structure. When force creates stress (like impact or bending), it concentrates at tiny surface flaws. Once stress exceeds the strength of molecular bonds, cracks propagate rapidly through the structure. Unlike metals that bend, glass can't deform plastically - it just breaks! That's why even small scratches weaken glass significantly.
Wrong. Normal air pressure doesn't crush glass. Glass breaks when applied force creates internal stress that exceeds the strength of bonds between its molecules.
Wrong. Glass breaks from mechanical stress, not melting. While extreme heat can soften glass, typical breaking happens when stress overcomes the molecular bonds holding the rigid structure together.

Wrong. Normal vibrations don't break glass (despite the myth about opera singers!). Glass breaks when mechanical stress from impact, bending, or thermal shock exceeds the strength of its molecular bonds.
explanations_zh: 正确！玻璃之所以易碎，是因为其分子被锁定在刚性的非晶结构中。当外力（如冲击或弯曲）产生应力时，应力会集中在微小的表面缺陷处。一旦应力超过分子键的强度，裂纹便会迅速在结构中扩散。与能够弯曲的金属不同，玻璃无法发生塑性变形——它只会断裂！这就是为什么即使是微小的划痕也会显著削弱玻璃的强度。
错误。正常气压不会压碎玻璃。玻璃在受到外力导致内部应力超过分子间结合力时才会破裂。
错误。玻璃破裂是由于机械应力而非熔化所致。虽然高温能使玻璃软化，但通常的破裂发生在应力超过维持其刚性结构的分子间作用力时。
错误。正常振动不会使玻璃破裂（尽管有关于歌剧歌手的传说！）。玻璃之所以破裂，是因为冲击、弯曲或热冲击产生的机械应力超过了其分子键的强度。

questions.question_en: Why do airplanes fly?
explanations_en: Wrong. Engines provide forward thrust, not upward lift. It's the wings that generate lift by directing air downward, creating an upward reaction force.

Correct! Wings are curved on top and flatter below. As the plane moves forward, air flows faster over the curved top (Bernoulli's principle) creating lower pressure above. More importantly, the wing's angle deflects air downward. By Newton's third law, pushing air down creates an equal upward force - lift! When lift exceeds weight, the plane flies. Engines provide forward speed; wings generate lift!
Wrong. Propellers (or jet engines) provide forward thrust, not upward lift. Wings generate the upward lift force by directing air downward as the plane moves forward.

Wrong. While pressure differences contribute, it's more accurate to say wings redirect air downward, creating an upward reaction force (Newton's third law). Engines move the plane forward; wings create lift.
explanations_zh: 错误。发动机提供的是向前的推力，而非向上的升力。升力是由机翼通过向下引导空气，产生向上的反作用力而生成的。
正确！机翼上表面呈弧形，下表面较平直。当飞机向前飞行时，气流在弧形上表面流动更快（伯努利原理），导致上方气压降低。更重要的是，机翼的角度使气流向下偏转。根据牛顿第三定律，向下推动空气会产生大小相等的向上作用力——升力！当升力超过飞机重量时，飞机便腾空而起。引擎提供前进速度，机翼则产生升力！
错误。螺旋桨（或喷气发动机）提供的是向前的推力，而非向上的升力。机翼通过飞机前进时引导空气向下流动来产生向上的升力。
错误。虽然压力差起到一定作用，但更准确的说法是机翼将空气向下引导，产生向上的反作用力（牛顿第三定律）。发动机推动飞机前进；机翼产生升力。

questions.question_en: Why do wheels make things easier to move?
explanations_en: Correct! Wheels reduce friction dramatically! When you drag an object, the entire bottom surface rubs against the ground (sliding friction). With wheels, only a tiny point touches the ground at any moment (rolling friction), which is much smaller. Instead of sliding, the wheel rolls over obstacles. This means you need far less force to move heavy objects - that's why even ancient civilizations invented wheels for transport!

Wrong. While wheels are round, that alone doesn't explain why they help. The key is reducing friction - rolling friction is much less than sliding friction because only a small point contacts the ground.
Wrong. Weight distribution helps comfort but doesn't explain easier movement. Wheels work by replacing high sliding friction with much lower rolling friction at the contact point.

Wrong. While rotating wheels have angular momentum, that's not why they make movement easier. The main benefit is reducing friction - rolling creates far less resistance than sliding the entire surface.
explanations_zh: 正确！轮子极大地减少了摩擦力！当你拖动一个物体时，整个底面都会与地面摩擦（滑动摩擦）。而使用轮子时，任何时候只有极小的一点接触地面（滚动摩擦），这种摩擦力要小得多。轮子不是滑动，而是滚过障碍物。这意味着移动重物所需的力大大减少——这就是为什么连古代文明也发明轮子用于运输！
不对。虽然轮子是圆的，但这并不能完全解释它们为何有用。关键在于减少摩擦——滚动摩擦远小于滑动摩擦，因为只有一小部分接触地面。
错误。重量分布有助于提升舒适度，但并不能解释移动更轻松的原因。轮子的工作原理在于用接触点上低得多的滚动摩擦替代了高滑动摩擦。
错误。虽然旋转的轮子具有角动量，但这并非它们使移动更容易的原因。主要好处在于减少摩擦——滚动产生的阻力远小于整个表面滑动时的阻力。

questions.question_en: Why does friction create heat?
explanations_en: Wrong. While surfaces may compress slightly, that's not the main heat source. Friction converts kinetic energy (motion) into thermal energy by making molecules vibrate faster.

Correct! This is energy conversion! When surfaces rub, tiny bumps and ridges collide at the molecular level. This converts kinetic energy (motion) into thermal energy. The collisions make molecules vibrate faster - and faster-vibrating molecules mean higher temperature! Rub your hands together - you're converting motion into heat. That's why brakes get hot and why rubbing sticks can start fires!
Wrong. Air plays a minor role. The heat comes from energy conversion - when surfaces slide past each other, kinetic energy transforms into thermal energy through molecular collisions.

Wrong. Friction is usually a physical process, not chemical. Heat is generated by converting kinetic energy to thermal energy as surface molecules collide and vibrate faster, not through chemical reactions.
explanations_zh: 错误。虽然表面可能会轻微压缩，但那并非主要热源。摩擦通过使分子振动加快，将动能（运动）转化为热能。
正确！这就是能量转换！当表面相互摩擦时，微小的凸起和脊线在分子层面发生碰撞，将动能（运动）转化为热能。这些碰撞使分子振动加快——振动越快的分子意味着温度越高！搓搓你的双手——你正在将运动转化为热量。这就是刹车会发热、摩擦木棍能生火的原因！
不对。空气的作用微乎其微。热量来源于能量转换——当表面相互滑动时，动能通过分子碰撞转化为热能。
错误。摩擦通常是一种物理过程，而非化学过程。热量的产生是由于表面分子碰撞并加速振动，将动能转化为热能，而非通过化学反应。

questions.question_en: Why do shadows change size during the day?
explanations_en: Correct! As Earth rotates, the Sun appears to move across the sky, changing its angle. When the Sun is low (morning/evening), light hits objects at a shallow angle, casting long shadows. At noon, the Sun is high overhead, creating short shadows directly below. The shadow is longest at sunrise/sunset and shortest at noon. This is why ancient people used sundials to tell time!

Wrong. While Earth's rotation causes the Sun's apparent movement, saying 'rotation and tilt' is too vague. The direct answer is that the Sun's angle in the sky changes throughout the day, affecting shadow length.
Wrong. Atmospheric refraction has minimal effect on shadow length. Shadows change size because the Sun's angle relative to objects changes as Earth rotates, not from light bending in the atmosphere.
Wrong. Objects don't expand enough to noticeably change shadow size. Shadows change because the Sun's position in the sky changes throughout the day, altering the angle at which light hits objects.
explanations_zh: 正确！随着地球自转，太阳看似在天空中移动，角度随之变化。当太阳位置较低（早晨/傍晚）时，光线以较小角度照射物体，投下长长的影子。正午时分，太阳高悬头顶，形成直射下方的短影。日出日落时影子最长，正午时最短。这就是古人利用日晷计时的原因！
错误。虽然地球自转导致太阳的视运动，但说“自转和倾斜”过于模糊。直接答案是，太阳在天空中的角度在一天中不断变化，从而影响影子的长度。
错误。大气折射对影子长度的影响微乎其微。影子大小的变化是由于地球自转导致太阳相对于物体的角度改变，而非光线在大气中的弯曲所致。
不对。物体膨胀的程度不足以明显改变影子的大小。影子变化是因为太阳在天空中的位置一天中不断变化，从而改变了光线照射物体的角度。

questions.question_en: Why do spinning tops stay upright?
questions.question_zh: 旋转的陀螺为何能保持直立？
explanations_en: Wrong. Centrifugal force acts outward but doesn't explain the upright stability.

Correct! Angular momentum creates gyroscopic stability. A spinning object resists changes to its rotation axis. The faster it spins, the more stable it becomes—that's why tops wobble more as they slow down!
Wrong. Air pressure plays no significant role in keeping tops upright.
Wrong. Gravity still acts fully on spinning objects. It's angular momentum that provides stability.
explanations_zh: 错误。离心力向外作用，但并不能解释直立稳定性。
正确！角动量产生陀螺稳定性。旋转的物体抵抗其旋转轴的变化。旋转越快，稳定性越强——这就是陀螺在减速时摇晃得更厉害的原因！
错误。空气压力对保持陀螺直立并不起重要作用。
错误。重力对旋转物体依然完全作用。提供稳定性的是角动量。

questions.question_en: Why do old books turn yellow?
explanations_en: Wrong. Dust sits on surfaces but doesn't cause yellowing of the paper itself.
Correct! Paper contains lignin which oxidizes when exposed to air and light, creating yellow-brown compounds. Acid in cheaper paper accelerates this. That's why archival paper is acid-free!
Wrong. Ink behavior doesn't cause paper yellowing. The paper itself chemically changes.
Wrong. Mold causes different damage patterns, not uniform yellowing.
explanations_zh: 不对。灰尘落在表面，但不会导致纸张本身变黄。
正确！纸张中含有木质素，当暴露在空气和光线下时会氧化，产生黄褐色化合物。廉价纸张中的酸会加速这一过程。这就是为什么档案用纸是无酸的！
错误。墨迹行为不会导致纸张变黄。纸张本身会发生化学变化。
错误。霉菌造成的损害模式不同，并非均匀变黄。

questions.question_en: Why does water expand when freezing?
questions.question_zh: 水为什么在结冰时会膨胀？
choices_zh: 冰中含有被困住的空气。
explanations_en: Wrong. Air bubbles are minimal. The expansion is due to molecular arrangement.

Correct! Water molecules form a hexagonal crystal structure when freezing, spacing them farther apart than in liquid form. This is why ice floats and pipes can burst in winter—ice is about 9% less dense than water!
Wrong. Molecules don't change size. They just arrange differently in solid form.
Wrong. No water is added during freezing. The same molecules just take up more space.
explanations_zh: 错误。气泡极少。膨胀是由于分子排列所致。
正确！水分子在冻结时会形成六方晶体结构，使得它们之间的间距比液态时更大。这就是为什么冰能浮在水面上，以及冬季水管会冻裂的原因——冰的密度大约比水小9%！
不对。分子的大小不会改变，它们只是在固态时排列方式不同。
错误。冷冻过程中不加水，同样的分子只是占据了更多空间。

questions.question_en: Why do hot air balloons float?
choices_en: Hot air is lighter than cold
explanations_en: Correct! Heating air makes molecules move faster and spread apart, reducing density. The less dense hot air inside the balloon is buoyant in the denser cold air outside—just like a bubble rising in water!
Wrong. Balloon fabric has no anti-gravity properties. It simply contains the hot air.
Wrong. Fire heats the air but doesn't directly push the balloon. Buoyancy does the lifting.
Wrong. Heating air doesn't create helium. Hot air balloons use regular air, just heated.
explanations_zh: 正确！加热空气会使分子运动加快、间距增大，从而降低密度。气球内部密度较小的热空气在外部密度较大的冷空气中产生浮力——就像水中的气泡上升一样！
不对。气球布料本身并不具备反重力特性，它仅仅是用来包裹热空气的。
错误。火加热空气但不直接推动气球，是浮力使其上升。
不对。加热空气并不会产生氦气。热气球使用的是普通空气，只是加热了而已。

questions.question_en: Why do pendulum clocks keep time?
questions.question_zh: 为什么摆钟能准确计时？
choices_en: Swing time is constant for length
choices_zh: 重力对重物均匀施加拉力。
explanations_en: Wrong. While gravity powers the clock, it's the pendulum's properties that keep accurate time.
Correct! A pendulum's period depends only on its length, not the swing size. This isochronism, discovered by Galileo, means each swing takes the same time—perfect for timekeeping!
Wrong. Gears transfer motion but the pendulum itself is what regulates timing accuracy.
Wrong. Air resistance actually causes slight inaccuracy. The constant period comes from pendulum physics.
explanations_zh: 错误。虽然重力为钟表提供动力，但保持时间准确的是摆锤的特性。
正确！单摆的周期仅取决于其长度，而非摆动幅度。这种由伽利略发现的等时性意味着每次摆动耗时相同，非常适合用于计时！
错误。齿轮传递运动，但钟摆本身才是调节计时精度的关键。
错误。空气阻力实际上会导致轻微的不准确性。恒定的周期源于摆的物理原理。

questions.question_en: Why do bubbles always form spheres?
questions.question_zh: 为什么气泡总是形成球状？
choices_zh: 表面张力使面积最小化。
explanations_en: Correct! Surface tension pulls the soap film into the smallest possible shape for a given volume—a sphere. This minimizes surface energy, which is why free-floating bubbles are always round!
Wrong. While air pressure is equal inside, it's surface tension that creates the spherical shape.
Wrong. Soap reduces surface tension but doesn't determine the shape. Geometry does that.
Wrong. Gravity actually distorts bubbles slightly. In zero gravity, bubbles are even more perfectly spherical.
explanations_zh: 正确！表面张力使肥皂膜在给定体积下收缩成最小的形状——球体。这最小化了表面能，因此自由漂浮的泡泡总是圆形的！
错误。虽然内部气压相等，但形成球形的是表面张力。
错误。肥皂能降低表面张力，但并不决定形状，几何结构才是关键。
错误。实际上，重力会使气泡略微变形。在零重力环境下，气泡会更加接近完美的球形。
